page.title: 12The Royal Oak,Little Bradley
page.content: The Royal Oak is one of several attractive local public houses in this area.The building dates from the 1880's and there is an eighty-foot deep well in the garden.Before it was a public house,the building was used as a garage and a petrol station.During the Second World War,because of it's close proximity to the airfield at Stradishall,it was used by airmen of two fighter squadrons,who autographed the walls and ceiling.Unfortunately this has now been painted over. The Royal Oak is a free house and sells a wide selection of beers,the most popular of which is Greene King,brewed at Bury St. Edmunds. Families are welcome in the new dining-room,where a varied menu is available.
